page.title: 03LAGHAM PARK FARM
page.content: The farm is situated a few hundred metres south of the village of South Godstone. It is about 100 hectares and is split in two by the A22 road. The farmhouse is sited on the edge of the main road to the right as you leave the village. It is a sheep farm stocking 350 'Mule' breed animals chosen for their hardy character. The farm has been in the Collard family for 60 years. It is now run by Mr.John Collard and his wife. Mr. Collard's father lives in retirement in a bungalow adjacent to the farm house. The farm is one of four in the area which at one time formed the{ {Lagham Manor Estate.}It is family run with outside labour used during the busy lambing period. A National Gas Well which has been disused for the past 20 years is due to reopen for local industry.
